result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley W. Caswell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Restitution to be paid:
Joseph Phalen, Sr.  $425
Colleen Wurzinger  $225

miscConds.notes: To be determined if a timely request is filed for a restitution hearing.  If no request, the restitution amount is $650.00 based on the restitution summary provided to the court.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wesley W. Caswell in court with attorney Melinda R Alfredson-Clausen. Defendant Wesley W. Caswell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:10 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Alfredson-Clausen makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Requesting a restitution hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
120 days jail, STAYED
7 days credit.
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
Restitution: To be determined if a timely request is filed for a restitution hearing.  If no request, the restitution amount is $650.00 based on the restitution summary provided to the court. 
Pay costs and appropriate surcharges.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 11:30 am.
filed by ADA C.C.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Atty Alfredson-Clausen
Pre-trial conference at 03-07-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Wesley W. Caswell in court with attorney Jerod Barkley (pro bono). Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:32 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing this morning.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court, wrote a letter to the State and to the Court regarding representation.
Atty Barkley filed a motion to withdraw which the Court granted.
Atty Barkley then advised the Court that his appearance today is pro bono.
Atty Barkley is appearing pro bono to correct his error.

Defendant is not accepting the plea agreement and disputes the restitution summary.

Atty Barkley requests the Court to let the motion to withdraw stand and allow Defendant to discuss matter with the public defender's office.

Atty Cousins does not have a position as to entering a plea. If there is a question as to the restitution, there could be a restitution hearing.

Defendant addresses the Court regarding issues, disputes the requested restitution.

Court understands that the Defendant disputes the requested restitution.
Court did sign the order discharging Atty Barkley but might have thrown a wrench into things.
Court appreciates Atty Barkley's presence and stating position and documenting the history.

Court advises Defendant that it is important to proceed with counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the public defender's office to name another attorney to represent Defendant.

Defendant addresses the Court, does not live in Wisconsin.

Atty Barkley will provide original order to the public defender's office and will notify them of a new appointment, recommends a pretrial date be set.

Address is verified. Modoc Street is mailing address. Michigan is physical address.
Defendant is serving 2 years probation in Waupaca County.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders Defendant to go see public defender's office today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Wesley W. Caswell in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Wesley W. Caswell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:42 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant's wife is in the courtroom today and will co-sign the signature bond.
